body.p: includes a Find/Replace side pane to help you find and replace content in the current document. To open the Find/Replace side pane, select the Find/Replace tab in the vertical stripe on the right side of the screen. You You can also click the Search button on the upper toolbar or use the keyboard shortcut to open the pane.
The Find/Replace pane includes the following:

dlentry.dd: This is where you will enter the text that you want to find. The number of results that are found in the current document are shown on the right side in this field and the results are highlighted in the editor. On Desktop devices, you can also use the Enter key on your keyboard to find the next occurrence.
You can enter text that you want to replace the text you entered in the Search for field. On Desktop devices, you can also use the Enter key on your keyboard to perform the replace operation.
If selected, the search operation will only find results if the exact letter case entered in the Search for field is found.
If selected, the search operation will only find results if the entire word or words entered in the Search for field are found.

This drop-down menu allows you to specify the scope of the search. You can choose from the following:
In content and attribute values - Searches for the results in both content and attribute values.
Only in content - Searches for the results only in content.
Only attribute values - Searches for the results only in attribute values. Results found in attributes values are displayed with [Attribute] in front of the result for easy identification.
Goes to the next occurrence of the result (on Desktop devices, you can also use the down arrow on your keyboard).
Goes to the previous occurrence of the result (on Desktop devices, you can also use the up arrow on your keyboard).
Use this button to perform the replace operation on the current result with the text specified in the Replace with field.
Use this button to perform the replace operation on all occurrences of the text specified in the Replace with field.

section.title: Other Notes About the Find/Replace Pane

ul.li: A preview of each search result is presented inside the side-pane. This preview includes some text around the search result. If there are more than 200 search results, the previews are not presented.

The results are also highlighted in the editor. While the search session is active, the results are updated after any change is made to the document. For large documents, this may slow down editing. To end the search session, you can clear the Search for field.
If you close the Find/Replace pane and then reopen it without editing the document, your search result is preserved.
If you select content in the editor and then open the Find/Replace pane, the Search for field will automatically be populated with the selected content.
The Match case and Whole words options are persistent in your current editing session so it remembers your selection from the last search.

section.title: Find/Replace in Text Mode
section.p: There is also a Find/Replace mechanism if you are editing in Text mode (Edit XML Source from the More drop-down menu). To access the options, click the Search in the top-right corner of the editor and it will expand to reveal the options.
